title._content: Map of Franklin County, Ohio, 1883 (Upper Arlington Area)

description._content: This portion of an 1883 map of Franklin County, Ohio includes land that eventually became the City of Upper Arlington (other cities are also included near the outer borders). The area depicted in this section of the map is bounded by the Scioto River to the west, the Olentangy River to the east, what is now Bethel Road to the north, and Fifth Avenue to the south. Note the upside down Y-shaped intersection near the center of the map; this is now the intersection of Tremont and Kenny Roads. This image available online at the UA Archives: ua-archives.cdmhost.com/u?/p116001coll0,1 ---------------------------------------- Identifier: map1883ua Date (yyyy-mm-dd): 1883 Original Dimensions: 12.0 cm x 12.6 cm Format: Map Original Publisher: Columbus, Ohio : G. J. Brand & Co. Location/s: Franklin County (USA, Ohio) Repository: Upper Arlington Public Library Digital Publisher: UA Archives - Upper Arlington Public Library Credit: UA Archives - Upper Arlington Public Library (Repository: UA Public Library)
